content: this legal text discusses a case involving inheritance and the distribution of goods the applicant who is the sole testamentary heir challenged the decision that only intestate heirs are entitled to inherit the court of appeal allowed the appeal and sent the case back to the court of first instance for a new decision the text emphasizes that the assessment of the validity of the inheritance should be based on the date of the deceaseds death not the date the decision was made the court of appeal also states that special rules for succession farms should not be applied in this case the court of first instance made a decision based on a special rule for succession farms but it was annulled due to an error in the application of substantive law the case will be reexamined to determine the status of the deceaseds farm at the time of the succession the costs of the proceedings will be determined in the final decision
